description.plain:
Dr. Octagon is a time-traveling Jupiter native from the year 3000 who is incompetent in his medical fields as a gynecologist and surgeon.

It’s important to know that the Dr. Octagon character is formed by three people—DJs Dan The Automator and DJ Q-Bert, and MC Kool Keith—not Keith alone.

Dr. Octagon released in 1996 as the short version of Dr. Octagonecoloygst, which released a year later with a varied tracklist. There is also a 1996 instrumental-version of the album.

The Dr. Octagon character was later killed off by Keith’s character, Dr. Dooom, on the latter’s 1999 First Come, First Served.

Due to a loss of creative control over recorded Dr. Octagon material, the character was blasphemously resurrected on The Return of Dr. Octagon—Keith was disheartened at the tainting of Dr. Octagon’s legacy. The label chose to put it out without Keith’s, The Automator’s, or DJ Q-Bert’s input. Keith responded to this atrocity in 2008 with Dr. Dooom’s Dr. Dooom 2, in which Dooom details how he killed Octagon (“R.I.P. Dr. Octagon”), setting the record straight for his fans and spelling out “fuck you” to the abusive label.

The Dr. Octagonecologyst trio returned 22 years later in 2018 with Moosebumps: An Exploration Into Modern Day Horripilation. Moosebumps is the real, and final, follow-up to Dr. Octagonecologyst.

Dr. Octagon is a time-traveling Jupiter native from the year 3000 who is incompetent in his medical fields as a gynecologist and surgeon.

It’s important to know that the Dr. Octagon character is formed by three people—DJs Dan The Automator and DJ Q-Bert, and MC Kool Keith—not Keith alone.

Dr. Octagon released in 1996 as the short version of Dr. Octagonecoloygst, which released a year later with a varied tracklist. There is also a 1996 instrumental-version of the album.

The Dr. Octagon character was later killed off by Keith’s character, Dr. Dooom, on the latter’s 1999 First Come, First Served.

Due to a loss of creative control over recorded Dr. Octagon material, the character was blasphemously resurrected on The Return of Dr. Octagon—Keith was disheartened at the tainting of Dr. Octagon’s legacy. The label chose to put it out without Keith’s, The Automator’s, or DJ Q-Bert’s input. Keith responded to this atrocity in 2008 with Dr. Dooom’s Dr. Dooom 2, in which Dooom details how he killed Octagon (“R.I.P. Dr. Octagon”), setting the record straight for his fans and spelling out “fuck you” to the abusive label.

The Dr. Octagonecologyst trio returned 22 years later in 2018 with Moosebumps: An Exploration Into Modern Day Horripilation. Moosebumps is the real, and final, follow-up to Dr. Octagonecologyst.

songs.title: Earth People

description.plain:
If you sifted through all of Dr Octagenocologyst’s elements and attempted to tease out all the pertinent ones from the superfluous, you’d probably get left with only one or two songs. Earth People would definitely be included in this batch.

Earth People is a very concise, stereotyped reconstruction of the ‘Dr Octagonecologyst’ mantra. The lyrics cover a lot of range – Malpractice, space travel, recreational drug use, lecherous night-time activites, low-key broadsides directed towards Dr. Octagon’s enemies …

The production, consisting almost entirely out of synthesizers, does much to add to the song’s menacing vibe. Like all other production in the album, the production on this song was handled primarily by Kool Keith’s always dependable DJ and partner in crime – Daniel Nakamura aka Dan the Automator.

songs.embed_content: Read “Earth People” by Dr. Octagon on Genius

songs.title: Blue Flowers

description.plain:
Released in 1996, Blue Flowers is the second single from Dr Octagonecologyst – Kool Keith’s debut studio album. At a time when there was an evident slump in the underground scene, its insurgence sparked a rapid revitalization. To the many legions of Kool Keith fans worldwide, it’s a certified classic. Many years later, its status cannot be disputed.

In it Kool Keith takes on the role of a sociopathic and mentally unstable time-traveling gynecologist/surgeon. In between brief spurts of activity we can hear him ramble incoherently and the listener is apt to believe that he is in the throes of some particularly agonizing mental anguish.

Samples Bela Bartok’s “Violin Concerto No. 2”.

Blue Flowers Lyrics[Production by Dan the Automator]
"Let me show you somethin'"
"Let me show you somethin'"

[Verse 1: Dr. Octagon]

With priests, I'm from the Church of the Operating Room

I do indeed in greed, explore meet the patients

Three thousand!
Three thousand!

songs.full_title: No Awareness by Dr. Octagon (Ft. Scaramanga)
songs.title: No Awareness

description.plain: “No Awareness” may just be a post-impressionistist, post-apocalyptic magnum opus. Detailing the machinations of two Horror-Core villains, Dr. Octagon and Sir Melenik explore the trials and tribulations of cannibalism, Frankensteinesque grotesques, and the formula for constructing a fully-functioning alpha robot.

songs.title: Halfsharkalligatorhalfman

description.plain:
The closing hidden track from Dr. Octagon, this track was later added as an official track on the full-length Dr. Octagonecologyst a year later.

The original version featured a sampled intro skit, but the second version’s intro was done by “the dangerous 20-year-old uncle of Dr. Octagon"—Mr. Gerbik. Mr. Gerbik is a dangerous hybrid of a man: "half-shark, half-man, [with] skin like alligator.”

Keith’s wordplay is surreal as ever and is equally fascinating at the same time—the perfect closing song to Dr. Octagon.

In the background, a sample of Paul Mauriat’s “C'est la Chanson de Mon Amor” (earlier sampled by Automator on the track “Sleep”) can be heard playing throughout.

songs.embed_content: Read “Halfsharkalligatorhalfman” by Dr. Octagon on Genius

body.plain:
The closing hidden track from Dr. Octagon, this track was later added as an official track on the full-length Dr. Octagonecologyst a year later.

The original version featured a sampled intro skit, but the second version’s intro was done by “the dangerous 20-year-old uncle of Dr. Octagon"—Mr. Gerbik. Mr. Gerbik is a dangerous hybrid of a man: "half-shark, half-man, [with] skin like alligator.”

Keith’s wordplay is surreal as ever and is equally fascinating at the same time—the perfect closing song to Dr. Octagon.

In the background, a sample of Paul Mauriat’s “C'est la Chanson de Mon Amor” (earlier sampled by Automator on the track “Sleep”) can be heard playing throughout.

songs.lyrics:
Halfsharkalligatorhalfman Lyrics[Dr. Octagon Intro: Sample]
"I would have been completely dead had it not been for the Shark Man
Shark Man? *chuckling*
Judging from his appearance, that's the most appropriate name I could come up with for him
I hate this kid
This—uh—thing you're talking about
It had the body of a shark, and the arms and face of a man?
That's the chap
Holy jumping jackfish!"
[Dr. Octagonecologyst Intro: Mr. Gerbik]
*moaning and growling*
Yes—you have met the dangerous 20-year-old uncle of Dr. Octagon
I, myself— Mr. Gerbik: half-shark, half-man, skin like alligator
Carrying a dead walrus
Ooh, check it
[Verse 1: Mr. Gerbik]
With my white eyes, gray hair, face is sky-blue yellow
Sideburns react, my skin is colored lilac
My skin turn orange and green in the limousine
People think I'm mixed with shark, drinking gasoline
Underwater I breathe with lizards on my sleeve
Walking down Hollywood Boulevard with a credit card
Three alligators behind me, feel my skin is hard
Transvestites, and people watch space parasites
I left his head in the store, legs in the street
Body on Wilcox, with blood dripping off my feet
LAPD through gray clouds couldn't see me
I first turned rainbow, closed my eyes, watch my brain glow
People got scared and ranned away they think I'm weird
I was born this way, halfsharkalligator
Is he weird?

[Chorus: Mr. Gerbik]
Half-shark-alligator-half-man
"Half man, half shark!"
Half-shark-alligator-half-man
"Half man, half shark!"

[Verse 2: Mr. Gerbik]
My vomit fluctuates, covers your skull like protoplasm
Lightning bugs turn pink, on my tongue catches spasms
Green elephants, I battle streets with a zebra
My mechanism is more than Dionne's psychic voodoo
African bees, snakeskin's cobra spit through you my medical passes
You can't see, with 3D glasses
Carbon dioxide, pull it right through 'em with gases
My description dinosaur
I was made half-shark-half-man, my skin is like razor blades
Seven-oh-seven, Mr. Gerbik
Verbally no one change my thoughts, animals fly from Philly
My appetites more big it's time for wildebeests
Adjust my skulls, seven eyes switch hydraulic turtles
And shrimps, smack gorillas make 'em limp
Half-shark-alligator-man
You might also like[Chorus: Mr. Gerbik]
Half-shark-alligator-half-man
"Half man, half shark!"
Half-shark-alligator-half-man
"Half man, half shark!"
Half-shark-alligator-half-man
"Half man, half shark!"
Half-shark-alligator-half-man
"Half man, half shark!"

[Verse 3: Mr. Gerbik]
In my raw world, orangutangs dance for Thanksgiving
With skeleton bones and skunk tails is my mission
Holding backward raps to all my power packs
Baboons clap, and girl horses wanna hit the sack
With two bowls of ocean water, monkeys sniffin' ice
Contact Jupiter fools Martians bring my rice
I'm out flyin' with purple capes in the twilight
Oooh ooh ooh, tonight's the night
My oxygen region's New York to California
Half-shark-alligator-half-man!

[Outro: PBS "Nature"]
The water is deep, and it takes a supreme feat of strength to swim through the water plants while dragging a two hundred and fifty pound sambar... The crocodile's teeth are designed to seize and hold prey, not to cut through skin. During all the hours the sambar lay in the water they are unable to penetrate the deer's tough hide. The crocodiles make a few token objections; but in the end give up without the struggle3Embed

songs.full_title: Girl Let Me Touch You by Dr. Octagon
songs.title: Girl Let Me Touch You

description.plain:
The songs of Dr Octagenocologyst are of two types. The morbid ones and the perverted ones. Track 13 errs on the ‘pervert’ side of the continuum. With a title like “Girl Let Me Touch You There” this should not come as much of a surprise. Content-wise we see a definite toning down of Doc Oc’s antics. The lyrics are vulgar but decidedly less opaque.

Kool Keith would later go on to explore this theme more fully in his second studio album Sex Style.

songs.title: Real Raw

description.plain:
In Real Raw Kool Keith attempts to make up the arrears of the chronic lack of ‘Ultra’-magnetic present in the first five tracks of the album. This is the Kool Keith of yore. For those old fans of his who’d been unable to reconcile his new Dr Octagon persona with the old him, it is of course a huge boon. But for the rest of us it’s a mere distraction really. Not a bad one though. We’ve got the tight Kool Keith flow, gimmicks and crazy one-liners. You’ll be hard pressed finding anything less Octagon like in the album.

These lyrics appear on the Bulk Recordings reissue on Dreamworks

songs.title: Technical Difficulties

description.plain:
As one of two KutMasta Kurt produced tracks in Dr Octagonecologyst, Technical Difficulties has a distinctive aural soundscape. Little dribblets of spanish dialogue start off the song and a mellow, sombre violin string permeates the entire track.

Lyrically, we find Dr Octagonecologyst at his most dense. There’s complex metaphors galore and quite a few shots toward the Doc’s many detractors if you venture to look hard enough.

songs.full_title: I Got to Tell You by Dr. Octagon
songs.title: I Got to Tell You

description.plain:
This skit is Dr. Octagon’s answering-machine message that he improvises to make his shady appointments and operations appear legitimate.

The track gets its name from a vocal sample used in the track, and Dan The Automator also backs the skit with a Johann Pachelbel piece—click here.

songs.title: I’m Destructive

description.plain:
One of Dr Octagon’s more up beat songs. Kool Keith, ups the ante. An intense ride for the astute listener. Shade gets thrown. Contradictions and a half turn up out of the blue. I’m Destructive encapsulates the bumpy, unpaved thoroughfares of the Dr Octagon road trip.

Excellent use of non-sequiturs and shock imagery. Back references to earlier events tie this track and it’s progenitors into a loose storyline.

songs.lyrics:
A Visit to the Gynecologist Lyrics[Skit: Woman + Dr. Octagon]
Can you at least look the other way?
Ms. Willis—I am a physician. Besides—we are all girls. Okay, up on the table—chop, chop. On all fours. That's it, oooh, yeah. Now spread 'em. Ohhhh, what have we got here? Oh, mmmmm. Looks like your vehicular canal is somewhat constricted. How do you manage to accommodate large penises?
I don't—not of any kind. 
Oh, of course. I was just feeling you out, as it were, haha. Spread 'em!
Ugh—
C'mon—wider, wider. Wider. 
I'm gonna break. 
C'mon—wider, you can do it wider, can't you? Come on, okay. Now—I want you to practice this exercise, twice a day, for at least ten minutes: put one finger in, stir it around—and around—and around—and then another finger, and stir it around—and around—and around—and around—and another finger, and another—you get the picture, right?
Yes. 
And then, when you run out of fingers, move on to vegetables. The appropriate size and shape, of course. In no time at all, we'll have you up to summer squash! Admit it; you'll like having something fun wiggling around inside you, like a—caterpillar. 
Eww
Okay—like an eel. 
Ewwww!
Okay—like a cock. 
[Outro: Samples]You might also like1Embed

songs.full_title: Wild and Crazy by Dr. Octagon
songs.title: Wild and Crazy

description.plain:
Production wise, Wild and Crazy is where Dr Octagonecologyst reaches its acme. A well crafted track. Dan The Automator gives his all here, and Kool Keith just about blacks out, as he breathlessly airs out his thoughts. The lyrics, a textured mandala of thoughts and ideas, pay homage to Keith’s stylistic proclivities.

Kool Keith tries to strike a balance between the macabre and the neutral, but he largely fails in this regard. Content-wise Wild and Crazy, just like its name suggests, is a sordid affair.

songs.title: Bear Witness

description.plain:
On “Bear Witness,” Dan The Automator blacks out with the turntables, showing off his technique. Automator made a four-part series off of this track.

“Bear Witness II” is found on Handsome Boy Modeling School’s 1999 album, So… How’s Your Girl?.



“Bear Witness III,” unfortunately, got lost in a label-merging between MCA and Geffen and never made it onto an official album (besides the original soundtrack for snowboarding game SSX 3) and therefore can only be scavenged from YouTube.

Automator fittingly concluded the series with “Bear Witness IV” being found on Dr. Octagon’s final album in 2018, Moosebumps: An Exploration Into Modern Day Horripilation.

description.plain: If you encounter this song on the shorter, Dr. Octagon version of Dr. Octagonecologyst, you will notice that there is a hidden track. That hidden track is “Halfsharkalligatorhalfman,” which received its own place a year later on the track list of Dr. Octagonecologyst.

songs.lyrics:
Waiting List (DJ Shadow/Automator Mix) Lyrics[Verse 1]
You enter, step in the room four-o-five
My over compressed thoughts and waves make you get live
You are the patient, and I – your black doctor
Medical bills, insurance, cash in the ceiling
Dioxalyn fingerprints here ever since
I got my white suit pressed, out the cleaners
X-Ray shades with hard shoes and some razor blades
Who's the brother that's sick, and needs the operation?
Bullets removed from your head, Grand Central Station
I gotta cut off your ear, first behind your neck
Rip out the stomach, and open rectums to dissect
Shine the light inside, roaches crawling in your throat
I don't have tools, my hammer's dull, my drill is broke
[Hook]
I'm the doctor
You wait on the waiting list
Patients been here since this morning I dismiss
*scratched* 'The doc.. the doc..'
I'm the doctor
You wait on the waiting list
Patients been here since this morning I dismiss
*scratched* 'The doc.. the doc..'

[Verse 2]
Watching people vomit green, my potent, my list of pills
My office in Burbank, I hide the bodies in Beverley Hills
Seeking Kimbles and bits, a girl with small tits
Talking to herself, her dog, and having rabid fits
Green fly soup is on the way from the kitchen, troop
Looking at TB tuberculous on the window post
Ten dead dogs, a brown fox in the comatose
With no reps, I put more needles in they kneecaps
Some primitive screws in mind, yes and perhaps
A little sprinkle of Clorox in their vocal box
Some Pepto-Bismol, Pepsi-Cola, pack of Pop Rocks
Mix it all together with bugs to change the weather
You be coughing blue, with eyes like Mr. Magoo
Straight up cartoon, you're bound to fall out real soon
You might also like[Hook]
I'm the doctor
You wait on the waiting list
Patients been here since this morning I dismiss
*scratched* 'The doc.. the doc..'
I'm the doctor
You wait on the waiting list
Patients been here since this morning I dismiss
*scratched* 'The doc.. the doc..'

[Verse 3]
As you come in the bright, you ride the orange ambulance
Look at windows repel, see the mental patients dance
Doin' six and seven, steps ladies yells dance
Upside, downside, the wall flyin' through the hall
Mr. Reeves/Mysteries with yellow bees they fly, sting your face
You out there bumps, caught up with an acne case
Plastic surgery, your lawyer now refer to me
Giving you sketches, exquisive pictures of the gill man
What's the matter, are you happy? Nah, you're ill man
Standin' back, you choose a ticket
My spiritual laws of vitamins will turn your face wicked
You're invited to ride the glide to your homicide

[Hook]
I'm the doctor
You wait on the waiting list
Patients been here since this morning I dismiss

songs.title: Octagon Octagon

description.plain:
First single off the 2018 album “Moosebumps: An Exploration Into Modern Day Horripilation”.

Part of the verse from his 1996 song “Earth People” is sampled in the hook.

songs.embed_content: Read “Octagon Octagon” by Dr. Octagon on Genius

album.name: Moosebumps: An Exploration Into Modern Day Horripilation

body.plain:
First single off the 2018 album “Moosebumps: An Exploration Into Modern Day Horripilation”.

Part of the verse from his 1996 song “Earth People” is sampled in the hook.

songs.lyrics:
Octagon Octagon Lyrics[Intro: Paperboy]
Newspaper—The Daily Herald!
Octagon is back—people are going Octagon-crazy
This morning—people have went Octagon-crazy
The newspaper—newspaper!
People are delivering the formal's newspapers in your back yard
Octagon-crazy
Number one story today—Octagon went crazy

[Verse 1: Dr. Octagon]
I was writing Octagon in an Octagon-hat
With Octagon-underwear, taking an Octagon-bath
With Octagon-soap, my Octagon-motorcycle made by Octagon Bikes
Stand up late in Octagon Heights living that Octagon-life
Wiping the girls off with Octagon-baby-wipes
Using the Octagon-washing-machine to dry
Octagon-coats on Octagon-hangers
Octagon-posters made Octagon famous
The Octagon-germ became quite contagious
Left people upside-down, taking Octagon-painkillers
Octagon, to everybody so familiar
Octagon-condoms, with Octagon-tampons for women
Became a frenzy
Octagon-gasoline, people use it when their motors go empty
Octagon-dog food with Octagon-cat food
Did ya'll read Octagon News? People going Octagon, fool
With Octagon-girs and Octagon-dudes
With strippers even dancing with G-strings in Octagon-boots
[Interlude]
People said Octagon went crazy
He lost his mind, they said he was in a mental hospital
They said he was throwing all of his hair out
They say he was in there eating his own dog food
They say he was in there eating his own cat food
They said Octagon went crazy crawling up on the ceiling
He was crawling down the ceiling
Wearing boots, talking to the news crew on his bluetooth

[Verse 2]
Octagon-rice with Octagon-beans with Octagon-shrimp
Octagon-Stadium where The Octagons play
I hear it every day, Octagon-Arena with Octagon-orchestra
Octagon-milk backstage for every age
Octagon-surgery for people who need an Octagon-face
Octagon-belts for Octagon-waists
Octagon-curtains, everything Octa-refurbished
Octagon-turtles—and don't forget the Octagon-gerbils
Everything got the world going in Octagon-circles

[Interlude]
Hey, are you coming with Octagon again?
I said, Are you coming with Octagon again?
Are you really coming?
(Please, leave me alone)
You might also like[Outro]
Octagon, Octagon, Octagon Octagon
Octagon, Octagon, Octagon, Octagon
Put one leg on the wall, and one leg on the floor
Do the Octagon, do the Octagon
Do the Octagon, do the Octagon1Embed

songs.title: Blue Flowers (Revisited)

description.plain:
“Blue Flowers Revisited” is a remixed version of the album’s single, although has a whole different set of verses and added strings from the Bela Bartok sample.

The track initially started life as the “Stop confusing me remake” which appeared on the Mo' Wax single of Blue Flowers with an added Bjork vocal sample from the track “Play Dead.” This sample was removed from this album version.  This track appears as the closing track on the remastered Dreamworks version of the album.

songs.embed_content: Read “Blue Flowers (Revisited)” by Dr. Octagon on Genius

body.plain:
“Blue Flowers Revisited” is a remixed version of the album’s single, although has a whole different set of verses and added strings from the Bela Bartok sample.

The track initially started life as the “Stop confusing me remake” which appeared on the Mo' Wax single of Blue Flowers with an added Bjork vocal sample from the track “Play Dead.” This sample was removed from this album version.  This track appears as the closing track on the remastered Dreamworks version of the album.

To where I'm really going... shoobedowop

Optical biofeedback, magnetic borders, x-ray
You see skeletons fly north for the next day

Return

Back with intriguing positive minerals

With no condom, no rubbers will reach the testicles
